byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and AURELIEN BREEDEN

abstract: French authorities seize passports of six citizens suspected of trying to go to Syria for terrorist activities and are preparing travel bans for 40 more; new law allows imposition of six-month travel ban, which can be extended for up to two years, on suspected terrorists.
lead_paragraph: The French authorities began to use new counterterrorism powers to halt the stream of young people suspected of going to Syria to engage in terrorist activities.

headline.main: France Seizes 6 Passports Under Antiterrorism Law
headline.print_headline: France Seizes 6 Passports Under Antiterrorism Law

snippet: The French authorities began to use new counterterrorism powers to halt the stream of young people suspected of going to Syria to engage in terrorist activities.
